info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:28PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Catawba, northwestern Lincoln and southeastern Burke Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Morganton, or 7 miles east of South Mountains State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Mountain View, Hildebran, Icard, Conover, South Mountains State Park, Pleasant Grove, Cooksville, Propst and Vale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
